conclusion: Break down the problem into manageable parts and solve it step by step.
Identify the forces acting on the suitcase.
Gravitational Force (Weight): W = mg, Given m = 15 kg and g = 10 m/s², Therefore, W = 15 × 10 = 150 N.
Pulling Force (F): The pulling force is given as F = 90 N and makes an angle θ with the horizontal.
Normal Force (N): This is the force exerted by the ground on the suitcase, perpendicular to the surface.
Frictional Force (f): The frictional force opposes the motion and is proportional to the normal force. It is given by f = μN, where μ is the coefficient of friction.
Resolve the forces along vertical and horizontal axes.
Vertical Direction: N + F sin(θ) = W, N + 90 sin(θ) = 150, N = 150 - 90 sin(θ).
Horizontal Direction: F cos(θ) = f, Given f = μN, 90 cos(θ) = μ (150 - 90 sin(θ)).
Substitute N from the vertical equation into the horizontal equation: 90 cos(θ) = μ (150 - 90 sin(θ)).
Simplify the equation and find μ and θ.
